Technique: FORMED BY HAND; PAINTED; ENGRAVED; FAYENCE; ENGRAVED
Name: Small vase in blue-green faience
Description: This small vase in blue-green faience was part of four foundation deposits found in the pyramid of Aspelta at Nuri. The deposits also contained inscribed tablets and other containers. The small vase bears the cartouche of Aspelta (see E.6107A-B), son of Senkamanisken (see E.6097, E.6099, E.6103, E.6109A-B) and of Nasalsa (see E.6114, E.7363).
